Steps.Message: Update at 17:52 - This is Rob from the messaging team again - I'm glad to report power to the Dacre Avenue area should now be back on. I'm sorry for the continued disruption recently. We know there is a fault developing on our underground cabling in the area, but currently it has not reached a severe enough state for our staff to pinpoint. Their tests have proved inconclusive, so for now they have gotten your power back on as quickly as possible. This may happen again before we're able to fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We became aware of a power cut at 15:38. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Power cut reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Engineers investigating and fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power restored

We know there is a fault developing on our underground cabling in the area, but currently it has not reached a severe enough state for our staff to pinpoint. Their tests have proved inconclusive, so for now they have gotten your power back on as quickly as possible. This may happen again before we're able to fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

UKPNIncident.PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault occurred on a piece of our electrical equipment which controls the power to your home.
